page.title: 03LAKE OF LLYN HELYG
page.content: The only lake in the block is called "Llyn Helyg" which lies 587 feet above sea level. It is approximately half a mile long by a quarter of a mile wide. It is an artificial lake privately owned by Lord Mostyn, Mostyn Hall Estates, Mostyn, Clwyd, constructed in the l7th Century for the purpose of fishing and ice-skating. It is a shallow lake fed by natural springs and formed by a low dam at it's Western end. There are two streams running into it with the surrounding, dense, deciduous wood forming a natural habitat for birds and wildlife.Today the lake is stocked with Perch, Tench, Rudd and Pike with the fishing rights being leased by the Mostyn Estates to the local Holywell and District Angling Club.
